identified-content.org: NORTON AIR FORCE BASE (SAN BERNARDINO, CALIF)
identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Manufacturing, Operations and Logistics

body.head.byline: Special to The New York Times

block.p: LEAD: A subsidiary of the Lockheed Corporation said it had signed a lease to take over a hangar at Norton Air Force Base in San Bernardino, Calif. Norton is one of 86 military bases scheduled to be closed by 1994. The value of the lease was not disclosed.

LEAD: A subsidiary of the Lockheed Corporation said it had signed a lease to take over a hangar at Norton Air Force Base in San Bernardino, Calif. Norton is one of 86 military bases scheduled to be closed by 1994. The value of the lease was not disclosed.

A subsidiary of the Lockheed Corporation said it had signed a lease to take over a hangar at Norton Air Force Base in San Bernardino, Calif. Norton is one of 86 military bases scheduled to be closed by 1994. The value of the lease was not disclosed.

The Lockheed Aircraft Services Company, which does commercial jet maintenance, plans to occupy two of the four bays in the hangar by the end of the year and the two remaining bays when the Air Force leaves. Lockheed will perform maintenance and modifications on commercial 747 jetliners.
